title: Reading the Question
text: The probability question asks for the probability that the committe has more than four men. Remember that the group of interest is the men. Also remember that the size of the group of interest is different than the size of the sample.

title: Determining the Size of the Group of Interest
text: Knowing that the group of interest is the men and that the size of the group of interest (what we want to determine) is the overall size of the group, not just what we expect or the number we're looking for. In other words, how many men are in the organization?
